Successfully completed the Culminating Project, an applied integrated care project that demonstrating a student’s innovation in the field, and ability to respond creatively and competently to the needs of rapidly evolving patient populations and healthcare environments. e4be3d99-b9b2-4645-8b31-2c5424726279.description: This webinar will look at the current epidemic of autoimmune diseases and chronic system inflammation, as well as how chronic inflammation affects various mental and emotional problems.

Completion of this program results in a transcript designation of certificate completion.

546d693b-4916-4a0d-b745-6350f2b93284.description: Everyone, regardless of race, can have unconscious racial bias. When social work professionals allow these internal biases to become reality it impacts our ability to make a difference and limit what we believe people are capable of. To confront implicit bias, practitioners must examine their own biases they bring to their practice. This session will give participants the tools necessary to increase self-awareness and avoid personal biases when working with a diverse clientele.
546d693b-4916-4a0d-b745-6350f2b93284.name: Understanding and Mitigating Impicit Bias

issuer.summary: issued by Cummings Graduate Institute for Behavioral Health Studies

entity.name: Cummings Graduate Institute for Behavioral Health Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 1 hour of asynchronous, on-demand presentation on understanding implicit bias for mental health professionals. Passed a posttest related to the identified learning objectives with an 80% miminum score.

fce9445e-d3d1-4957-b104-c8e488910911.description: We all have biases. As healthcare professionals we are called to address biases in order to have a more equitable healthcare system. It can feel overwhelming and burdensome to learn another thing in the fast-moving, ever-changing world of healthcare. Cultural Humility is explored to help facilitate our everyday interactions with the diverse communities that we serve. We will reveal practical steps to reduce biases that can be implemented in everyday encounters with patients.
fce9445e-d3d1-4957-b104-c8e488910911.name: Cultural Humility: Moving Beyond Cultural Competence in Pursuit of Health Equity

issuer.summary: issued by Cummings Graduate Institute for Behavioral Health Studies

entity.name: Cummings Graduate Institute for Behavioral Health Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 1 hour of asynchronous, on-demand presentation on cultural humility and health equity.

e23b30df-00c4-4e15-8733-33461ecedc91.description: We will explore the definitions of eating disorders, including the newest feeding and eating disorders described in the DSM-5. We will discuss their current clinical presentation in our culture, review diagnostic criteria, and informal patterns of eating disorders and how they show up clinically. Then dive into assessment of eating disorders to help ensure these deadly diseases are detected and treated with highly specialized care.
e23b30df-00c4-4e15-8733-33461ecedc91.name: Diagnosing Eating Disorders with Compassion

issuer.summary: issued by Cummings Graduate Institute for Behavioral Health Studies

entity.name: Cummings Graduate Institute for Behavioral Health Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 1 hour of asynchronous, on-demand presentation on diagnosing eating disorders. Passed a posttest related to the identified learning objectives with an 80% miminum score.

79856e28-d753-42d6-9e2d-5a28134f86cc.description: This webinar invites mental health professionals to explore emotional self-care, while understanding the need to practice skills related to the mind and the impact of stress, fatigue, and trauma. Participants will gain insights germane to the ethical responsibility of self-care practice. Several approaches to managing stress will be identified. Participants will have the opportunity to create a wellness to toolbox and a personal self-care plan in support of their emotional health.
79856e28-d753-42d6-9e2d-5a28134f86cc.name: Emotional Self-Care for Mental Health Professionals

issuer.summary: issued by Cummings Graduate Institute for Behavioral Health Studies

entity.name: Cummings Graduate Institute for Behavioral Health Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 1 hour of asynchronous, on-demand presentation on the importance of emotional self-care as a mental health professional. Passed a posttest related to the identified learning objectives with an 80% miminum score.

97f58737-5895-46e6-84c0-0dc42a5c8f2c.description: Body image and self-love can be a direct casualty of living in today's diet culture. New models of body positivity and self-compassion are seeping into our collective conscience and providing respite for the disconnection created by diet culture. Learn about traditional methods of healing body image through Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, alongside the newer treatment implications for body positivity Health At Every Size (HAES), and self-compassion in healing body image.
97f58737-5895-46e6-84c0-0dc42a5c8f2c.name: Healing Body Image with Compassion

issuer.summary: issued by Cummings Graduate Institute for Behavioral Health Studies

entity.name: Cummings Graduate Institute for Behavioral Health Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 1 hour of asynchronous, on-demand presentation on healing body image. Passed a posttest related to the identified learning objectives with an 80% miminum score.

5b342c34-ba88-47a4-9c3c-99b0624fd0fb.description: The treatment of eating disorders has evolved, as the knowledge in the field has become more scientific. Knowing the most up-to-date treatment and best practices for eating disorders is part of ethical treatment. We will explore the appropriate treatment team to use with eating disorder clients, the use of inpatient level of care, and current effective eating disorder treatments. We review; CBT, imagery and metaphor, as well as DBT in order to highlight the tools available to clinicians.
5b342c34-ba88-47a4-9c3c-99b0624fd0fb.name: Healing Eating Disorders with Compassion

issuer.summary: issued by Cummings Graduate Institute for Behavioral Health Studies

entity.name: Cummings Graduate Institute for Behavioral Health Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 1 hour of asynchronous, on-demand presentation on healing eating disorders. Passed a posttest related to the identified learning objectives with an 80% miminum score.
